body_html:
@boyuzhangus: That's a separate issue. It sounds like you either a) don't have bazel installed correctly or b) you have bazel installed correctly but it's not in your path. On my computer, bazel is in $HOME/bin, so I added the following to my .profile:

export PATH="$PATH:$HOME/bin"

If you continue to have issues after you have bazel properly installed, please file a separate issue unless you are having the exact issue that I reported with this specific flag.
